channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Microsoft says it blocked Tiananmen Square searches outside China due to 'error'
item.description: Microsoft says Bing blocked searches for the Tiananmen Square 'tank man' outside the US due to 'human error.'

item.title: Fossil won't upgrade existing watches to the revamped Wear OS
item.description: Fossil is working on a 'premium' Gen 6 smartwatch, but it won't upgrade Gen 5 models to the redesigned Wear OS from Google and Samsung.

item.title: Twitter suspended in Nigeria amid face-off over president's tweet
item.description: Nigeria says it has suspended Twitter use in the country after the social network removed a threatening tweet from President Buhari.

item.title: Facebook buys studio behind collaborative game-making platform 'Crayta'
item.description: Unit 2 Games is now part of Facebook Gaming.

item.title: G7 deal will likely raise taxes for tech giants like Apple and Google
item.description: G7 countries have reached a deal that will likely increase taxes for tech giants like Apple, Amazon and Google.

item.title: Kia 2021 Niro EV adds tech perks while maintaining the price
item.description: Kia has unveiled the 2021 Niro EV, which adds new features like wireless CarPlay and Android Auto while maintaining the same price.

item.title: GM's Cruise can give California passengers fully driverless rides
item.description: The California Public Utilities Commission has issued Cruise the permit needed to give passengers a ride without a driver behind the wheel.

item.title: ICYMI: The new Apple TV 4K gets a significantly better Siri remote
item.description: This week's tech reviews on Engadget include the new Apple 4K TV, the latest Google Pixel Buds A-Series and the Dyson V15 Detect vacuum.

item.title: Apple employee group rejects planned return to the office
item.description: Apple employees sent a letter objecting to a policy that will require them to return to offices in September, arguing that they should be allowed to work remotely unless necessary.

item.title: Hitting the Books: Future humans may mine rare earth metals from today's landfills
item.description: As futurist Byron Reese and entrepreneur Scott Hoffman explain in their new book, Wasted, mining rare earths is an intensive endeavor akin to extracting "a tablespoon of pepper that has been randomly spread through a pound of salt."

item.title: Read bestselling books in 15 minutes with Blinkist
item.description: Blinkist Premium offers thousands of condensed nonfiction books and podcasts that you can process in just 15 minutes, with 70 new titles added every month.

item.title: JMGO's O1 is a surprisingly affordable ultra-short-throw projector
item.description: JMGO, an up-and-coming Chinese brand, has significantly lowered the entry barrier for ultra-short-throw projectors, starting with the O1 and the Leica-branded O1 Pro.

item.title: The Morning After: Which streaming TV box or stick is the best one for you?
item.description: We'll help you pick a streaming TV box (or dongle, or game system) and run down the tech news highlights of the week.

item.title: DOJ charges Latvian national for helping develop the Trickbot malware
item.description: The Department of Justice has charged Alla Witte, a Latvian national accused of being part of the Trickbot Group.

item.title: Apple, Google, Microsoft and Mozilla team up for a 'common vision' on extensions
item.description: Collaboration by Apple, Google, Microsoft and Mozilla should make it easier for extension developers to create tools that work across multiple browsers.

item.title: Colonial Pipeline ransomware attack linked to a single VPN login
item.description: Last month's pipeline shutdown started with hackers taking advantage of an unused but still active VPN account at Colonial Pipeline.

item.title: USAF looks into commercial rocket-powered cargo delivery
item.description: The US military is expanding an experimental program that could one day see the Space Force use reusable rockets to move material and equipment across the planet.

item.title: Facebook's 'Bulletin' newsletter platform could launch before the end of June
item.description: Facebook hopes to release Bulletin, its take on a Substack-like newsletter subscription product, toward the end of June.

item.title: Microsoft partners with voting machine maker Hart on election security
item.description: ElectionGuard software lets voters check their votes were counted properly.

item.title: Tinder will let you block people based on their phone number
item.description: Using its newly introduced Block Contacts feature, you can prevent people you have in your phone's address book from showing up when you go to swipe on Tinder.

item.title: Fiat plans to become an EV-only automaker by 2030
item.description: The company will start phasing out combustion engine vehicles in 2025.

item.title: Square may make a 'hardware wallet' for Bitcoin
item.description: Square may make a bitcoin hardware wallet, says Jack Dorsey.

item.title: Facebook will walk back controversial ‘newsworthiness’ rule for politicians
item.description: Facebook will change one of its most controversial rules, following recommendations from the Oversight Board.

item.title: How long before AI can 'understand' animals?
item.description: Advances in artificial intelligence could decypher animal "language" in the next 10 years or so, scientists claim.

item.title: Don't expect Saints Row, Metro, Dead Island or TimeSplitters at E3
item.description: Deep Silver says those franchises won't be featured at Summer Game Fest either.
